text: Municipal elections were held in the Czech Republic on 20 October and 21 October 2006. The Civic Democratic Party received 35% of the vote, winning more seats than any other party. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|Civic Democratic Party | 39,353,957 | 36.20 | 7,033 |- |align=left|Czech Social Democratic Party | 18,079,942 | 16.63 | 4,332 |- |align=left|Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia | 11,730,243 | 10.79 | 4,268 |- |align=left|Christian and Democratic Union – Czechoslovak People's Party | 6,263,980 | 5.76 | 5,049 |- |align=left|Green Party | 5,475,862 | 5.04 | 408 |- |align=left|SNK European Democrats | 3,858,734 | 3.55 | 1,284 |- |align=left|Vote for the City | 1,097,815 | 1.01 | 185 |- |align=left|Other parties | 22,837,144 | 21.02 | 39,867 |} ==References== 2006 Category:2006 elections in the Czech Republic Category:October 2006 events in Europe
title: 2006 Czech municipal elections
